subject: PORT
name: Honors: Lusophone Cultures
info: Foundations of Portuguese-speaking cultures (Portugal, Brazil, Lusophone Africa) from origins to present. Social/cultural trends that are basis for modern Portuguese-speaking world (literature, history, cinema, music).

subject: PORT
name: Honors: Brazilian Culture
info: Emphasizes modern Brazilian society. History, culture (e.g., music, art, cinema, literature, intellectual thought, popular culture, media), social problems (e.g., ethnicity, tropical deforestation).

subject: PORT
name: Honors:Lit & Cult Luso Africa
fullname: Honors: Literatures and Cultures of Lusophone Africa
info: Origins/development of Lusophone Africa (Angola, Cape-Verde, Guinea-Bissau, Mozambique, Sao Tome, Principe) using literature, cultural/literary criticism, history, anthropology, and various media (e.g., film, art, music, Internet).

subject: PORT
name: Honors: Film in Portuguese
info: Films from Portuguese-speaking world in their historical, (geo)political, and socio-economic contexts. Films from Brazil, Portugal, or Lusophone Africa analyzed under interdisciplinary framework, noting aspects related to cinematography/rhethorics.

subject: PORT
name: Hon: FilmStudiesinPortuguese
info: Films from Portuguese-speaking world in their historical, (geo)political, and socio-economic contexts. Films from Brazil, Portugal, or Lusophone Africa analyzed under interdisciplinary framework, noting aspects related to cinematography/rhetorics.

subject: PORT
name: Honors: Lusophone Literatures
info: Lusophone literary texts (from Brazil, Portugal, Portuguese-speaking Africa) representing various genres (e.g., novel, short story, poetry). Terminology of criticism, literary problems, techniques.
